column14: The flight crew encountered poor weather conditions and made an emergency landing. The aircraft landed in a field badly damaged and written off.
Unknown.
While attempting to land, the engine failed, the aircraft stalled and crashed.
Crashed after an unsuccessful attempt at fly into strong headwinds. The engine quit and the plane nosedived into the ground.
Crashed following engine failure.
NULL
The three engine seaplane stalled and crashed into the sea shortly after taking off.
Crashed after experiencing engine failure and attempting to make a forced landing.
A broken wire led to the partial loss of the the rudder and a crash landing which resulted in the aircraft striking a tree, killing the flight engineer.
The postal plane crashed for unknown reasons.

The sightseeing plane took off and rose to 400 ft. when the engine failed.The plane stalled and plunged to the ground in an apple orchard. Engine failure. The pilot was not familiar with the type of aircraft.

While flying 1,000 km east of the Canadian coast, the crew sent a mayday message and the aircraft crashed into the ocean two minutes later. The plane was owned by William Randolph Hearst who financed this nonstop transatlantic flight.
From an altitude of 500 ft. the plane went out of control and crasheddue to a broken wing strut.
The plane crashed while attempting to land at Dakar.
Went into a tailspin and crashed into a corn field about 10 km from the airport.
The mail plane crashed shortly after taking off.
Crashed in the gulf of Finland and never found.
The postal plane crashed at night in poor weather.
A fire erupted aboard the mail plane while en route and crashed.
Suffered structural failure at an altitude of 1,000 ft.
